roleset.name: fill to capacity, crowding past capacity, full

example.name: crowd-v: passive, prepositional arg2
example.text: [The school-board hearing at which she was dismissed]-1 was crowded *trace*-1 with students, teachers and parents who came to testify on her behalf.
example.arg: with students, teachers and parents who came to testify on her behalf.

example.name: crowd-v: arg2 in subject position
example.text: ``Personal Computer'' yearbooks are lined up on nearly every desk, and dog-eared copies of Nikkei Computer crowd magazine racks.

example.name: crowd-v: predicative arg1
example.text: In another compartment called the Linden Bosque, [62 linden trees]-1 were *trace*-1 to be crowded *trace*-1 together at killing intervals of 10 or 16 feet.
example.arg: at killing intervals of 10 or 16 feet.

example.name: crowd-v: agentive
example.text: Travelers crowded into subways, sat in traffic jams on major freeways or waited for buses in the rain, but the massive gridlock anticipated by officials in the San Francisco Bay area never materialized.

example.name: crowded-j
example.text: The whole lot . Yeah , when-1 it 's crowded like that it 's impossible to get a steady pace going .

roleset.note: CROWD-V NOTES: Be very careful to distinguish the agent of filling (intentional) andthe thing filling the container--although they can be merged, as in the last example, and in these cases the lower number wins. (from crowd.01-v)
CROWDED-J NOTES: Added by Julia basedo n BOLT. (from crowded.01-j)

roleset.name: get too close to, violate personal space

example.name: crowd-v: gimme some space, man
example.text: He no longer crowds the plate.

example.name: crowded-j: both args
example.text: was feeling crowded by his wild arm movements

roleset.note: CROWD-V NOTES: There might be some clever way to merge the two sets. (from crowd.02-v)
